task_summary: The robot is instructed to pick up the red object from the table, requiring perception, grasping, and removal from the surface.

task_long_description.overview: In this sequence, a robotic arm locates and grasps a red cylindrical object placed on a black tabletop, as visible in the contact sheet frames. The robot must first perceive and identify the red object, maneuver its gripper above and in alignment, execute a controlled approach until contact is detected, firmly close the gripper to grasp the object, verify the object is held, and retreat from the table. The process ensures accurate localization, gentle grasp, and successful pickup.
preconditions: Red object is present and positioned on the table surface
Workspace is clear of obstructive objects
Robotic gripper is operational and open
stepwise_plan: Check if red object is visible; if not, scan to reacquire.
Detect the red object for precise pose.
Move above the red object at a safe offset height.
Approach and align with the object for grasping.
Lower gripper slowly until contact detected.
Close gripper with moderate force to grasp object.
Verify that object is inside gripper.
success_criteria: Red object securely held in gripper
Object lifted off the table without slip or drop
failure_and_recovery: Object not detected: Rescan using grid pattern up to three times
Unstable grasp: Retry grasp or re-position
Contact not detected: Lower slightly more within safe depth
task_long_description.termination: Task terminates when red object is successfully grasped and lifted from the tabletop.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red object can be seen in the workspace.
Scans workspace to locate the red object if not visible.
Performs object detection to localize pose of the red object.
Opens gripper to a width suitable for grasping the red object.
Moves gripper above the red object at a safe vertical offset.
Approaches and aligns gripper with object within precise tolerance.
Lowers gripper gently until contact with red object is detected.
Closes gripper with moderate force to grasp red object.
Verifies the red object is securely held in gripper.
Retracts gripper and held object away from table.

assumptions: Visual inspection of frames confirms red cylindrical object as intended target. Instruction and frames are consistent.
Table markers (blue) are not the target.
No transfer or place action required beyond pickup: no subsequent place frames indicated.
Gripper width, force, approach speed inferred from object size and shape in images.

expected_success_criteria: Red object is detected, grasped, and lifted with clear separation from table.
